[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [PeerId Validation] Line 42 passes my_peer_id - is this validated to be a legitimate validator, or can a non-validator initialize a ProofManager? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Proof-Batch Desync] Can proofs be received via receive_proofs() before their corresponding batches arrive via receive_batches(), and how is this handled? (High)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Orphan Proofs] If a proof is received but its batch never arrives, does it remain in batch_proof_queue forever consuming resources? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Batch Store Dependency] Since pull_batches_with_transactions() fetches from batch_store, can a corrupted or compromised batch_store return different data than what proofs attest to? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [OptQS Parameter Attack] Lines 131-152 check maybe_optqs_payload_pull_params - can malicious params be used to exclude all batches or only include specific validator's batches? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [OptQS Batch Age] Line 147 uses minimum_batch_age_usecs - can this be set to exclude recent batches, causing delays in transaction inclusion? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [OptQS Resource Calculation] Lines 132-133 calculate max batch sizes by subtraction - can incorrect calculations allow optqs batches to exceed total limits? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Inline Batch Condition] Lines 156-184 only pull inline batches if proof_queue_fully_utilized is true - can attackers manipulate this condition to prevent/force inline batch usage? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Inline Transaction Data] Line 168 calls pull_batches_with_transactions - are these transactions validated against their summaries before inclusion? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Inline Limit Calculation] Lines 158-166 calculate max_inline_txns_to_pull with complex logic - can edge cases cause this to be 0 even when capacity exists? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Max Txns Enforcement] Is max_txns actually enforced, or just a soft limit that can be exceeded if batch granularity is large? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Filtering Limit] max_txns_after_filtering accounts for deduplication - can duplicate transactions be counted incorrectly allowing limit bypass? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Soft Limit Semantics] What is the semantic difference between max_txns_after_filtering and soft_max_txns_after_filtering, and can this be exploited? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Return Non-Full] What happens if return_non_full is false but available batches are insufficient - does it return empty or wait? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Proof Queue Utilization] Line 114 returns proof_queue_fully_utilized - how is this calculated and can it be manipulated? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Unique Transaction Count] Line 114 returns cur_unique_txns - is this count accurate considering transaction deduplication across batches? (High)

[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Type Conversion] Lines 189-203 convert between BatchInfoExt and BatchInfo via .info().clone() - can this conversion lose data or introduce inconsistencies? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Signature Unpacking] Lines 199-202 unpack ProofOfStore into info and signature - is the signature verified to match the info? (Critical)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Clone Overhead] Multiple .clone() calls on BatchInfo - can these clones be avoided, and do they preserve all relevant data? (Low)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Shutdown Handling] Lines 296-301 handle Shutdown by breaking the loop - are there cleanup operations that should happen before shutdown? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Graceful Shutdown] If Shutdown is received while processing a proposal, can this cause the proposal to be lost or partially completed? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Resource Cleanup] After shutdown, are batch_proof_queue resources properly cleaned up or can they leak? (Low)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Empty Proof Block] Line 213 checks if both proof_block and inline_block are empty - can an attacker force this condition repeatedly? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Zero Limits] If request.max_txns or max_txns_after_filtering is 0, does the code handle this gracefully or panic? (Medium)
[File: consensus/src/quorum_store/proof_manager.rs] [Negative Logic] Line 156 checks allow_batches_without_pos_in_proposal AND proof_queue_fully_utilized - what happens if only one is true? (Low)
